verses.roman:
punaḥ kṛṣṇa-rati haya duita prakāra
aiśvarya-jñāna-miśrā, kevalā-bheda āra

synonyms: punaḥ—again; kṛṣṇa-rati—attachment for Kṛṣṇa; haya—becomes; duita—twofold; prakāra—varieties; aiśvarya-jñāna-miśrā—knowledge of Kṛṣṇa mixed with a reverential attitude; kevalā—pure attachment; bheda—division; āra—other.
translation: "Attachment for Kṛṣṇa is divided into two categories. One is attachment with awe and reverence, and the other is pure attachment without reverence.
